rev.comment: [[WP:RBK|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/174.5.76.213|174.5.76.213]] ([[User_talk:174.5.76.213|talk]]) to last revision by R-41 ([[User_talk:TTTSNB|Report Mistake]]) ([[WP:HG|HG]])
clean up, typos fixed: as as → as using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
/* Ideological origins of Fascism */ Grammar correction
/* Ideological origins of Fascism */ This is more in line with what the source says
/* Ideological origins of Fascism */ Removed excess words in the sentence
/* Ideological origins of Fascism */ Splitting run-on sentence in two and putting in present tense
/* Ideological origins of Fascism */ Spelling correction
/* Ideological origins of Fascism */ As it is a form of writing, material in it should be addressed in present tense
/* Ideological origins of Fascism */ This is not an ideological origin of fascism
rephrase this sentence in the lead some more
just conventional left-right spectrum is fine....neo-fascists here in north america are also identified to the right...it's not a european thing at all....

The source is an article by Mussolini, not "a Marxist website"; but moved out of the lede, as it's a primary source
These two sentences were from a Marxist website. As Marxists and fascists are aggressive opponents of each other I do not think a Marxist website can be considered neutral
Changed the sentence, a number of Jewish Germans considered themselves to be German but the Nazis did not recognize them as German
The case of South African fascists would not involve a minority group
/* Racism and racialism */ The Fascist International's position on anti-Semitism
/* Position in the political spectrum */ This should be put on the article of the Montreux conference
/* Austrian Fatherland Front */ The Nazis had a policy exactly named Volksgemeinschaft, so this statement is inaccurate
/* Historical causes of the rise of fascism */

We shouldn't use primary sources unless the interpretation is supported by secondary sources
Whats good for the goose is good for the gander. Reference cited.
